page.title: 01Gullane, EAst Lothian
page.content: A sense of tranquility pervades this area which can roughly be divided one third sea (Firsth of Forth) one third golf course and the balance largely executive type houses. Sandy beaches dominate the coastline which is a mecca for holidaymakers. There is also a major nature reserve at Aberlady, arefuge for wild birds and plant conservation. Large flocks of migratory birds regularly visit this aea including the Greyland goose. Four golf course perambulate throughout the area. The highest feature is Gullane Hill, Approximately 200 people live on hill, the majority of whom are retired. Thse stillw orking commute to Edinburgh a distance of some 19 miles. In short, this is an area which is well described by tourist brochures as having 'A Sense of Time,Sense of Space
